intro: Oldenlandia setifera, commonly known as the slender leaf spiderwort, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that typically bloom in shades of white or pale yellow. The plant features opposite, linear leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, and it produces small, bead-like fruits known as drupes. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodland areas or along stream banks. Due to its ornamental value and ease of cultivation, it is sometimes grown in gardens as a decorative plant.
